  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30448].
  {panel}

when you go through the whats new video tour for the JIRA 5.2 release every video starts with a 10 second Atlassian + JIRA intro trailer

http://cl.ly/image/420Z3H3x3u2a

This is really annoying after you've seen the first one. I understand we are trying to re-use the videos on WAC as well as on the whats new feature tour.

Suggestion: In Youtube, you can embed videos and start at a specific time. So in the Whats new page, just start the videos after the 10 second intro so you don't have to watch that 3 times every time.
fields.summary: Every video in the JIRA "whats new" video for 5.2 displays the JIRA trailer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30447].
  {panel}

By default, JIRA requires that a user has the *Browse Project* permission for mail notifications to go out.  The Notification Helper does not seem to make this check.

!browse permission - null.png|thumbnail!
!notification helper - check.png|thumbnail!

With the above checks, Notification Helper indicates that the testuser should get an e-mail when a comment is made.  This is not the case, no e-mail is sent out.
fields.summary: Notification Helper does not check Browse Project permissions
Replace PermissionsArrayTransformer with a REST resource
Replace NotificationEventsTransformer with a REST resource

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30431].
  {panel}

We should have a way to disable all callbacks to Atlassian. This would include:

UPM
JIRA Feedback Button
Plugin Feedback buttons (such as GH)
Evaluation JIRA callback

This is important for people using JIRA in an environment where they are on a closed network and DNS timeouts clientside for some of these issues cause massive slowdown.

Current workaround is to nullroute atlassian.com on every single individual machine in the hosts file, or to add a zone entry for atlassian.com to your local DNS server to respond with 127.0.0.1.

There were mentions of this existing already, though I have not been able to find any documentation of it.
fields.summary: Switch to kill all callbacks to Atlassian
Give a possibility to recover the deleted issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30412].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently, User-Picker field fetches all users including in-active ones. What is the use case in fetching inactive users?

I think the API should fetch active users only or its behaviour should be in align with 'Assignee' field.

Regards,
Dipti Ranjan Behera

----

h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create an User Picker custom field in a system with inactive users.
# Click on the 'Select a user' icon (!browse_users.png!).
# A pop up opens displaying all the users, including inactive ones (URL: http://<JIRA_SERVER>/secure/popups/UserPickerBrowser.jspa?formName=jiraform&multiSelect=false&decorator=popup&element=customfield_<CF_ID>).

h4. Expected Results
Only the active users should be displayed - or it should be possible to at least filter inactive users out.
fields.summary: [User-Picker CF] this field should not fetch inactive users.
What's New Dialog points to the wrong place in OD
New issue search should not attempt to use unsupported comparisons

When creating issues I am doing the following:

* Check "Create another"
* Press Create

Shouldn't it clear at least the Description as well?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30395].
  {panel}

In our documentation for installing JIRA EAR/WAR, eg. :
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+6.0

Step 3 is to build JIRA which will produce the WAR files.

Step 4.2 contains instructions to remove any duplicate libraries in the JIRA Installation Directory, and if any were found, then to re-build JIRA. Currently, it seems like we bundle specific .jar files which are always duplicated from the .zip archive we also tell users to download and copy to Tomcat's lib directory.

I would suggest that we move the order of Step 3 to come after Step 4.2 as it is now, this way a user is not required to re-build JIRA. The workflow seems like this at the moment:
1. Build JIRA
2. Remove duplicate libraries
3. Re-build JIRA

We could move around the steps so that it would only by:
1. Remove duplicate libraries
2. Build JIRA
fields.summary: Installing JIRA WAR - step order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30394].
  {panel}

In our documentation for Installing JIRA EAR/WAR on Tomcat, it looks like there is a incorrect path for one of the lib directories.

Using this page as an example:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+6.0

Section 4.2 mentions:
"To prevent exceptions related to logging, please ensure that the following files are present in Tomcat's lib directory. Also ensure that these files are not present in the webapp/jira/WEB-INF/lib subdirectory of the JIRA Installation Directory. If any of the following files are present in the webapp/jira/WEB-INF/lib subdirectory, remove them and rebuild the deployable JIRA WAR file as described in the previous step (above)."

The subdirectory webapp/jira/WEB-INF/lib subdirectory of the JIRA Installation Directory does not exist.

The correct path in the above example is <jira-install>/webapp/WEB-INF/lib

Not to be confused with the path in the Tomcat installation directory:
<tomcat-install>/webapps/jira/WEB-INF/lib
fields.summary: Installing JIRA WAR documentation - path for libraries incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30378].
  {panel}

Rather than trying to figure out "which exact panel each setting is in" between "jira admin" and "project admin" and all the sub-categories of settings headings, wouldn't it be great to be able to just "type" the name of the setting you remembered?

For example, "Permission Schemes" is hidden under "Misc". It took me 30 minutes to find it in the new AOD/JIRA UI design. That's just a search for a heading, what about when I can't remember which screen an obscure but critical parameter is on? In these cases, I end up googling it, sifting through 2 or 3 old articles, finding the "where to find this" and then remapping this back to my own config. A little index of the screens plus some autocomplete would save a ton of work.

I have ranked this as "major" given that every time I set about making changes in any part of my atlassian config(s), it generally loses 0.5-2 hours of my day. This in itself isn't the cure, but it would save about 25%.

Applies equally to Standalone and self-hosted.

This request would be similar to apple osx settings panel.
fields.summary: Search for setting feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30377].
  {panel}

JIRA is very difficult to use on Mobile devices without a plugin or a third party app. 

This is a feature request to bundle *anything* which improves this for AOD customers.

Currently, we use AOD with Google Apps authentication, which rules out 100% of the third-party apps.

Suggest free or paid option to include any of the mobile-friendly plugins or (this may be unrelated) allow dual-logins for third party app authentication.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30371].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 January 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

CORS has been supported in the JIRA REST API since JIRA 6.0 for JIRA Server. If you are a JIRA Server customer, simply go to the "Whitelist" section of JIRA Administration and add the domains you wish to request resources from. *Note:* You must have the System Administrator global permission to access this section of JIRA administration.

Unfortunately, this domain whitelist is not available in JIRA Cloud for security reasons. We haven't yet been able to spend time developing a pattern for supporting this in JIRA Cloud, but we do intend to work on this at some point in the future.

I have updated the issue summary to more accurately reflect the current status of this feature.

Regards,

Dave Meyer
 [dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
 Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
JIRA REST API documentation ([http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#authentication]) says: ... if you are using JIRA in a browser you can call REST from Javascript on the page and rely on the authentication that the browser has established.

However it does not work, see my example [http://jsfiddle.net/avalez/nCcq9/2/] and others complains: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/69356/cross-origin-resource-sharing-with-jira-rest-api-and-javascript]

Looks like Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header is missing.

CAUTION, to make it really work for remote clients, it's necessary to respond with exact match for host name in Access-Control-Allow-Origin header, see related AMKT-3342 ([https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-3342]).
fields.summary: Allow cross-domain requests for CORS
As a JIRA user, I would like the ability to bulk change the link field for several issues

Hello,
In the configuration scheme context, where we choose the Applicable Context, it would be nice to disable the projects list when *Global context* is selected.

It would prevent administrators from choosing a project and forgetting to check the radio button *Apply to issues under selected projects*.

!ApplicableContext.png!

The problem behind the current behavior is that an administrator can almost do the job but because he forgets to check *Apply to issues under selected projects*, all the jira project will be changed.

Thanks,
Best regards.
fields.summary: In Field configuration scheme context, disable projects list when Global context is selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30349].
  {panel}

Many are the times when, in Atlassian Support, we ask our customers to create a Support Zip and send it to us so that we take a look under the hood.

However, there might be times when our friends get a timeout, thus coming back to Support empty-handed.

This can be due to a few factors but perhaps it would make sense for us to include in the documentation a few things to try before calling it a "failure to get the Support Zip":
* Check if they are using a proxy to access JIRA. If so, it makes sense to access JIRA directly (e.g. through port 8080) and try again.
* Check in $JIRA_HOME/export in case the Support Zip is created there anyway and they just get an error in the UI.

I know these two steps are not a _fix_ but, when there is an issue we usually look for a way to bypass this to get to the logs and help with the actual case.
fields.summary: Mention common Support Zip errors in the documentation
Add comment during publishing workflow
Add command-line details to Using the JIRA Configuration Tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30340].
  {panel}

Before the upgrading, the server.xml has been modified as following:
* Server Port: changed from 8005 to 8008
* Connector Port: changed from 8080 to 28080
* Context path: changed from "" to "/jira"

then upgrade from JIRA 5.1.4 to 5.1.7 by running the "atlassian-jira-5.1.7-x64.bin" installer.
The port numbers will be changed automatically after the upgrade, but the context path will not be changed. We have to modify it again manually. It is expected behavior, but the plugin system initialization may take several minutes, so if I stop the server during the auto-restart period, JIRA will not be able to start up and locked as the data is corrupted.

It will be great if the warning message can be improved to reminds user:
Improve from
{quote}
Custom Modifications
Your previous JIRA installation contains customisations (eg server.xml) that must be manually transferred. Refer to our documentation more information: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Upgrading+JIRA
{quote}

TO

{quote}
Custom Modifications
Your previous JIRA installation contains customisations (eg server.xml) that must be manually transferred. Refer to our documentation more information: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Upgrading+JIRA

Please make sure the JIRA upgrading has been complete and you are able to accessed at http://localhost:8080. Otherwise DO NOT try to stop jira manually, it might cause upgrading fail."
{quote}
fields.summary: Warning message during the upgrading JIRA on Linux

fields.description:
The choice of searchers for the two standard text-based custom fields has changed in 5.1.7 and 5.2. When you create a text custom field there used to be an Exact Text Searcher and a Free Text Searcher. Now there is just the Exact Text Searcher.

Similarly single select custom fields no longer have the option of a Single Select Searcher, only the Multi Select Searcher.

Changing the searcher types for these fields changes the operators available in JQL searches. All my saved filters with clauses such as: 
MyCustomTextField = 'ABC'
now need to be replaced by
MyCustomTextField ~ 'ABC'

I marked this as Critical because I don't want to have explain that most of a customer's saved filters were invalidated by an upgrade.
fields.summary: Searchers have changed for text and single select fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30324].
  {panel}

As a user, I would like to be able to use non consecutive issue numbers. Instead, I could define a per project numbering scheme. This scheme would be based on variables of different kinds. Some examples:

Current Date (also more customizable)
Num of issues filed this day

Implementation examples:

PRJKT-103112-05 Project_Key-Month_Day_Year-Issue_number_that_day
PRJKT-102012 Project_Key-Month_Year

This would be more in line with the needs and business standards of many Asian Pacific countries.
fields.summary: Customizable Issue Numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30309].
  {panel}

If your commit has a well-formed git-style commit message like:
{noformat}PROJECT-1234: Convert baubles into trinkets

We previously used baubles to fill the shelves, but this limited the
number of items that could fit because baubles are fragile. Now, we
use trinkets instead, which are less expensive, and can be packed
into the shelves more efficiently.
{noformat}

...then if you hit the "Source" tab on the ticket mentioned, and use the {{+}} button to create a review in Crucible for that commit, then the review's title is something like {{PROJECT-1234: Convert baubles into trinkets We previously used baubles to fill the shel...}}.

It would probably be better to understand the message as a git-style commit message, and use the first line only, as that's what it's for.
fields.summary: Using "+" on a Jira ticket's "Source" tab to create a Crucible review results in an overly long review subject line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30293].
  {panel}

When replying to an e-mail that was sent to create a JIRA issue, instead of adding a comment to the related issue, as it should according to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-Issue/commentcreation], the reply e-mail is creating a new JIRA issue.
As he does not find the JIRA Issue Key in the e-mail subject, he should check the in-reply-to header of the e-mail to see if the first e-mail of the chain created an issue, and it seems the system is not doing that.

*Steps to reproduce*

# Send an e-mail to create and issue with a Cc to yourself or another e-mail.
## This e-mail has the example ID: 1234
# Wait for the issue to be created.
## JIRA replies with an e-mail that has the example ID: ABCD
# Now, using the CC address, just reply the email with ID: 1234 that created the issue.

The handler is not following the In-reply-to ID.

Expected behavior - The reply should be added as a comment to the issue.
Actual behavior - The reply is creating a new issue. (Duplicated one)
fields.summary: Duplicating issue when replying to e-mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30286].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

This suggestion is a priority for the JIRA development team, but I am not able to provide an accurate estimate for when this will be resolved. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Confluence 4.3 introduced WorkBox which has JIRA integration for notifications. 

This issue is to track the request of seeing WorkBox in the JIRA header.
fields.summary: Ability to see WorkBox-like notifications in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30284].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

If a user re-orders his/her favorite dashboards/filters, after re-ordering, the user is unable to configure the dashboards/filters anymore (the cog at the right side of each of the dashboards/filters). When the cogs are clicked, nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a few new dashboards
# Click on the 'Dashboards' dropdown menu, and click on 'Manage Dashboards'
# At the 'Favorite Dashboards' tab, re-order some of the dashboards there
# After re-ordering, try to click on the cogs at the right side

h3. Additional Info

* Sometimes, after re-ordering, when the cog is clicked, the dropdown menu will flash and disappear. After that, when the cog is clicked again, it will show as usual
* However, most of the time, nothing happens when it is clicked

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page and try again
fields.summary: Clicking cog icon on Shared Filters/Dashboards screen when the list is sorted does not work.
We shouldn't show the "Create dialog" you are on the create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30281].
  {panel}

As an administrator, I do not want to be required to input an email address for a JIRA user. Requiring an email has resulted in email spamming and looping when you have email via comments setup. 

First issue. 
Since you cannot remove a user that is associated with any item, you have to replace the email with something  If they are invalid and someone puts a comment on a page, and notification services are utilized for notifying people involved - then it sends an email to this invalid user.  This results in a reply that you have sent to an invalid user which is added as a comment on the issue since it replied back to JIRA and includes the JIRA issue in the subject.  Since this invalid email comment is added to this issue, it sends another email out....thus, a loop of emails that is never ending

Second issue. 
We have set up some generic users to identify roles.  For example, we setup users for roles of implementation manager, integration engineer, developer, etc.  This identifies who is responsible for the issue and indicates whose role it is in queue for. Then, as in KanBan model, you pick up from the top of what is available and assign it to yourself.  Thus, you can always see what is ready for that role and assigned/not assigned; these are also often used when we set up template issues/subtasks.  Then, once cloned, they will make the specific assignments. 

Again, these generic role users require a user ID.  We set them up with a valid email that is aliased. However, whomever it is aliased to must now manage that inbox to delete the emails as they are really invalid emails. 

The preference is 1) either make the email address an option for an admin to identify as required or not or 2) not make it required as all. 

Either way, it puts the option into the hands of the customer administrator to understand what happens if they don't input an email (e.g. that person doesn't receive email notifications) which, in my opinion, is pretty clear and self-explanatory.  However, by not requiring it, you avoid all of the email spam and additional management.
fields.summary: Not require email for user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30280].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue with sub-tasks.
 # In the sub-task list, click on the "cog" icon for a sub-task and choose *Link*.
 # In the _Link Issue_ window, choose *Confluence* and attempt to link to a Confluence page you desire.
 # Once the link has been created, notice that the Wiki Link in the _Issue Links_ appears in the _*parent issue*_; not within the sub-task that you've attempted to link to in steps 2 and 3.

View the attached screencast for a view.
h4. Workaround

Link the sub-task to a Confluence page when viewing the sub-task itself.
h3. *h3. Note*

This is happening when creating the links from Epic to Task/Story. See [JSW-14758|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14758].
fields.summary: Setting a Web Link/Confluence Link for a Sub-Task will Render the Link in the Parent Issue
Allow user to edit certain fields in a closed issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30275].
  {panel}

If an issue does not have a due date specified, it uses the due date of its fix version if the version has a due date.

But the affected Issues are not indexed during the operation.

The filter result shows the old due date. 
After commenting the issue, the resultpage shows the correct duedate.
fields.summary: build index If issue's due date unspecified and inherit the due date of the fix version is done
User's Roles page should display only project roles that the user is associated to
Consider adding an upgrade task to strip spaces from user email addresses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30264].
  {panel}

Can we please get a feature to prevent duplicate comments & attachments being entered onto a ticket.

Maybe make this a option to enable via the administration section or java_opts.

Typically Atlassian Internal IT see duplicate content submission occurring from a mail loop between Jira and another ticketing system when email submission is enabled.

Something like a sha1sum of the content, comment/attachment ID and ticket ID, stored in an extra table in the database would be required.

New content being entered could then sha1sum'd before being saved and the hash could be checked against existing sha1sums of the comments & attachments on that issue already.
fields.summary: sha1sum the content of comments & attachments to prevent duplicate comments & attachments
Give Warning message when trying to delete a Project Role which has comment only view-able by this project role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30261].
  {panel}

Please update the OnDemand Ninja training at http://quickstart.atlassian.com/ondemand/jira/ninja-training/admin-ninja/white-belt/.

The UI has changed and it is not reflected on the training, confusing new users.

Thanks!
Clarissa.
fields.summary: Update the Ninja training

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30260].
  {panel}

Currently, the Activity Stream retrieves the avatars for the updates depending on the application which Application Links are set.

For example, the user has set a custom avatar in JIRA, but is using the default avatar in FishEye. 
In the Activity Stream, sometimes the user sees his JIRA avatar, and sometimes his FishEye avatar. This is dependent on where the update came from.  If the update came from JIRA, then it will show his custom JIRA avatar. However, if the update came from FishEye, then it will show the default FishEye avatar, even if it is the same user in both sides.

This could cause some confusion. It would be useful if the user has a choice to determine the source for Activity Stream to retrieve avatars, for example to only take the avatars from JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to choose the source for Activity Stream to retrieve avatars
Allow admin user to choose either notification to be send when update issue or @mention or both action.
Ability to configure/filter the content of the Project level Activity Stream

fields.description:
Long text string doesn't wrap

We have a user who has entered a long text string (c.935 characters).  This doesn't wrap in the description field so the issue page has a very wide horizontal scroll bar.

The text entered is the equivalent of;

XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXV,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXVY,XXXXG,XXXWX,XXXWX,XXXXH,XXXWX,XXXWX,XXXWX,XXXWX,XXXXP,XXXWG,XXXXQ,XXXWH,XXXXX,XXXWJ,XXXXW,XXXYJ,XXXYQ,XXXYX,XXXXJ,XXXXL,XXXXP,XXXXS,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXL,XXXXX,XXXXN,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXU,XXXGP,XXXXZ,XXXGQ,XXXXX,XXXGX,XXXXX,XXXGX,XXXGZ,XXXHX,XXXQX,XXXHM,XXXJN,XXXXX,XXXHQ,XXXXH,XXXHU,XXXJX,XXXHW,XXXJZ,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXLX,XXXXX,XXXNX,XXXLN,XXXNX,XXXLQ,XXXNH,XXXNJ,XXXNL,XXXNQ,XXXNS,XXXNZ,XXXPL,XXXPX,XXXPX,XXXPX,XXXQX,XXXQX,XXXQM,XXXQN,XXXQQ,XXXQW,XXXXX,XXXQX,XXXXP,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXVX,XXXVJ,XXXVL,XXXVX,XXXWP,XXXWW,XXXVV,XXXWY,XXXVW,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXH,XXXXX,XXXXL,XXXXN,XXXXX,XXXXZ,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXM,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXX,XXXXS,XXXXW,XXXGX,XXXJX,XXXGX,XXXJX,XXXGX,XXXGN,XXXJX,XXXJX,XXXJX,XXXJX,XXXJX,XXXJX,XXXLX,XXXJX,XXXMX,XXXJL,XXXMX,XXXMX,XXXMX,XXXMX,XXXMP,XXXNX,XXXNX,XXXNX
fields.summary: Long text string doesn't wrap
Ability to disable 'hover profile' that appears when mouse hovers over username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30251].
  {panel}

Using iOS 6.0 devices, content of JIRA Mobile(JM) is not scrollable smoothly as it is possible in Confluence Mobile (CM).

Although JM looks like it has same interface as CM, but its behavior is different on long contents. 

With CM, it displays vertical scrollbar which allows user to scroll with flicking(or throwing).

Somehow, JM does NOT allow vertical scrollbar causing sticky scrolling experience.


Also, it makes Safari or Chrome crash when its content is very long, and if user try to open Configuration button or Side pane. 
Although crashing mobile browser is not responsibility of JM,
JM seems to render somewhat broken HTML entities causing crash and anti-scrolling.

Thank you.
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile is not scrollable smoothly with iOS devices.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30249].
  {panel}

In Target Process they have the ability to assign a Developer, a Tester (QA Engineer), and a Product Owner to each Issue. I really like this since it makes it clear who is responsible for each of these roles. (See attached) Bugzilla has this as well.

Please consider adding this to Jira/Greenhopper... soon please.

Thanks,
Edie Hovermale
fields.summary: Allow multiple types of assignment on Stories/Tasks/Bugs
Add project link documentation for Stash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30246].
  {panel}

As a lot of other users do with JIRA we bundle groups of issues into new Release Versions.  Each one of these issues is reviewed and receives an IMT Sign off as well as a Business Sign Off.  The purpose of the Business Sign-Off is to have a record of validation that the Business Units are aware and consent to the changes IMT is implementing. 

The problem is for most situations the business does not want to "Approve" each issue separately since they tend to not understand each technical change listed under each issue.  

Therefore It would be nice if we were able to have an approval happen on the Version from a group/user instead of having it done on each ticket.  

Thanks
fields.summary: Version Workflow/ Version Approval
